SEARCH
Package com.bteam.common.models

Class GridService

java.lang.Object
com.bteam.common.models.GridService
public class GridService extends Object
Service class for the GridModel

This class wraps a gridModel instance and provides useful functions for grid-manipulation and data-retrieval.

  • Constructor Details

    • GridService

      public GridService(GridModel gridModel)
      Constructor for the GridService class.
      Parameters:
      gridModel - tileGrid the service class manages

  • Method Details

    • getCharacterAt

      public CharacterEntity getCharacterAt(Vector2D position) throws DestinationInvalidException
      Tries to retrieve a CharacterEntity from the given Vector2D-position.
      Parameters:
      position - Vector2D-position the position in the tileGrid it searches in
      Returns:
      the CharacterEntity that occupies the referenced tile, or null if the tile is not occupied
      Throws:
      DestinationInvalidException - if the given position is invalid

    • setStartTiles

      public void setStartTiles(int[] rows) throws DestinationInvalidException
      Marks the specified rows in the tileGrid as start tiles.
      Parameters:
      rows - indices of the rows that should become start tiles
      Throws:
      DestinationInvalidException - if a given row index is invalid

    • swapCharacters

      public void swapCharacters(Vector2D one, Vector2D two) throws DestinationInvalidException, NoCharacterFoundException
      Tries to swap the two characters from tiles one and two.
      Parameters:
      one - Vector2D-position of the first character
      two - Vector2D-position of the second character
      Throws:
      DestinationInvalidException - if one of the positions is out of bounds
      NoCharacterFoundException - if one of the TileModel doesn't contain a CharacterEntity

    • moveCharacter

      public void moveCharacter(Vector2D from, Vector2D to) throws DestinationInvalidException, DestinationAlreadyOccupiedException, NoCharacterFoundException
      Tries to move the CharacterEntity found at from over to to.
      Parameters:
      from - Vector2D-position it tries to retrieve the CharacterEntity from
      to - Vector2D-position it tries to place the CharacterEntity at
      Throws:
      NoCharacterFoundException - if the from-position doesn't contain a CharacterEntity
      DestinationInvalidException - if the from or to positions are invalid
      DestinationAlreadyOccupiedException - if the to-position is already occupied

    • setCharacterTo

      public void setCharacterTo(Vector2D to, CharacterEntity character) throws DestinationInvalidException, DestinationAlreadyOccupiedException
      Tries to place the given CharacterEntity at the specified Vector2D-position.

      Will throw an exception if anything goes wrong. When using this method in initialisation, please check if the tile this command is performed on is a start tile first.

      Parameters:
      to - the Vector2D-position it tries to place the CharacterEntity at
      character - the CharacterEntity it tries to place at the Vector2D
      Throws:
      DestinationInvalidException - if the Vector2D-position is invalid
      DestinationAlreadyOccupiedException - if the destination-tile is already occupied

    • removeCharacterFrom

      public CharacterEntity removeCharacterFrom(Vector2D position) throws DestinationInvalidException, NoCharacterFoundException
      Removes the CharacterEntity from the specified Vector2D-position.
      Parameters:
      position - the position in the tileGrid it searches in
      Returns:
      CharacterEntity, which was removed from the tileGrid
      Throws:
      DestinationInvalidException - if the Vector2D-position is invalid
      NoCharacterFoundException - if the tile doesn't contain a character

    • getTileAt

      public TileModel getTileAt(Vector2D position) throws DestinationInvalidException
      Retrieves the TileModel from the specified Vector2D-position.
      Parameters:
      position - the position in the tileGrid it searches in
      Returns:
      the TileModel at the given position in the GridModel
      Throws:
      DestinationInvalidException - if the given position is invalid

    • checkPositionInvalid

      public boolean checkPositionInvalid(Vector2D position)
      Checks if the given Vector2D lies outside the dimensions of the tileGrid.
      Parameters:
      position - the position in the tileGrid it searches in
      Returns:
      true if the position is invalid, false otherwise

    • getDimensions

      public Vector2D getDimensions()
      A method for easy tileGrid dimension retrieval.

      Following the definition of the tileGrid model, x represents the cols and y the rows.

      Returns:
      Vector2D of the tileGrid dimensions

    • getGridModel

      public GridModel getGridModel()
